Dr. Crabb would also be skilled in managing complications associated with infectious diseases, such as sepsis, meningitis, pneumonia, and endocarditis. Furthermore, his expertise would extend to the prevention of infectious diseases. He would be knowledgeable about vaccine-preventable diseases and would be a strong advocate for vaccination. He would also be familiar with infection control measures and would promote their implementation in healthcare settings to prevent the spread of infections.
